intro: Aristolochia megalophylla, commonly known as the giant-leaf arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces striking, hooded flowers that are typically greenish-yellow with a distinctive scent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
